description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programs, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
HQ and RO technical support to multiple Goal Areas
Humanitarian planning and review activities (HRP, RRP, UNICEF HAC)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programs

description.narrative: In 2020, as a repercussion of the COVID-19 pandemic and subsequent restrictions on travel to DPRK where only two internationals are present since mid-August and a freeze on all travel within DPRK, regular programme monitoring through field visits has not been possible since January 2020 which has curtailed the ability of UNICEF to verify programme implementation. UNICEF is currently exploring different options to address this issue including through remote monitoring modalities though limited face-to-face meetings with Government officials is making the task challenging. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:28/08/2020
